column1: So if you see this one buy it at any price

column4: The series 3 Collectable minifig mummy is a great addition to any&nbsp
column7: collection. He has a great overall design and&nbsp
column8: crossover appeal to both LEGO fans and fans of classic horror.This little guy has detailed wraparound printing on his leg's which I found to be surprising and appealing, however the lack of the same treatment on the torso gives the piece an awkward look to a certain degree. Also it would seem that TLG really phoned it in with the amazing accesory.....a red scorpion. One more for the pit on Scorpion Pyramid.&nbsp

column4: mummy minifigure in the pyramid shaped shadow cast by the Pharaoh's Quest subtheme might seem like overkill, but upon further thought it becomes apparent that this is the best time to have troop buildable ""grunt"" mummies for your Egyptian army. I find that although the dim jade eyes and muted green flesh of the CM mummy is not an exact match to the grey skin and ruby eyes of the PQ undead, they mesh very nicely in a display.... especially when you have collectable minifig mummies in greater force.

column2: Overall a good buy if you are into troop building, mummies, or minifigures, but there is no real building experience to be had here, and $2.99 is probably the cheapest you are going to find this bad boy.

I thought it was coincidence that monsters such as a zombie, witch and vampire would appear but then it sunk in that Lego has clearly planned this, what more with the upcoming werewolf. So I wanted this piece regardless of whether it was up to mark or not for my monsters series.

column1: Details, as usual. The figure paint scheme has a kind of cartoony mummy feel. Maybe the kind one would expect to see in Scooby Doo cartoons and I like it. The grim expression gives the minifig 'life' or is it death? Hhmmm.

No idea why it comes with a red scorpion. Although this is my first red one in a sea of blacks.

,TRUE,5,4,3,5,3 Odeinoichus","2011-03-03T16:31:23.963Z","Abbot, ABBOT!","

Set #8803 Mummy: Obviously my review title will not be understandable to everyone, it is a clever nod to an old Universal film, Abbot &

That's what I thought of when I first saw the Series 2 and 3 Monster Mini-Figures. They look like something out of old Universal horror classics, and they are really quite nice. Just a shame I don't have any Series 2 figures yet.

This is not the first Mummy LEGO has ever given us. Adventurers has the honor of showing us the first LEGO Mummy Mini-Figure, well it's a Pharaoh Mini-Figure, but he's meant to be a Mummy. Then we saw a real Mummy in LEGO Studios and recently, this year in fact, LEGO Introduced us to the Warrior Mummies of Pharaoh's Quest.

The Series 3 Mummy however is definitely different, if anything I would have to say that this one is the very image of what one expects a mummy to look like. Since he isn't wearing any headdresses or anything. The print on this guy is almost perfect, not only does the torso have a front and back printing of mummy wrappings, but the arms and legs also have wrapping printed in certain key areas. (This is the only flaw in the figure, there are bare patches of white that aren't printed on, making for a very unaesthetic looking print.)
His head only has the print on his face, the sides and back don't show the wrappings, his face looks suitably decayed though with sickly green coloring and horrid green eyes with yellow pupils.

The Mummy comes with only one accessory. A very strange and standard accessory really, he's got a scorpion. Yes, I believe this is the first Collectible Mini-Figure to include one of the small LEGO Animals. And in a color you won't see anywhere else, a really dark red.

Overall I'd have to say that the Mummy is a worthy addition to your Mini-Figures collection and can actually fit nicely in any Egypt inspired themes or displays or even a Universal Monsters Movie Display.

",TRUE,4,3,1,4,4

column1: United_Bricks,"2011-10-09T10:03:20.88Z","Review of set 8803 Mummy","The Mummy is one of my favourite minifigures in series 3. Lego did a
good job making him look like a mummy. In this set you get a minifigure
Here is a little bit of history on legos other mummys before this one.

column3: src=""http://www.1000steine.com/brickset/minifigs/large/adv021.jpg"">This was one of the first mummys, it was from the theam adventures.
column5: src=""http://www.bricklink.com/ml/hrf007.jpg""> Then came this mummy, this was from the studios theam.
column7:
src=""http://www.1000steine.com/brickset/minifigs/large/pha003.jpg"">Then this mummy, what was from the pharohs quest theam.


His head is white and has printing on it. In the gaps between the bandages on his face, you can see green what makes it look like the skin is rotting away. He has light green eyes and a sad smile. His body once again has bandages printed on it and green in the gaps of the bandages. On his arms he has printing on them to. On his legs again more bandages.

He also comes with a scorpion, this one is dark red instead of black, so it is rare. The minifigure also comes with a stand to put him on.

The packaging is a green packet that you can't see through.


Overall Nice minifigure, one of the best in the series.

I hope I haven't bored you thanks for reading.

AETerry,"2011-04-08T16:14:31.84Z","Mummy Review","

On it's own, this minifigure is very well detailed, printing on the arms of the minifigure (not just legs) for bandages. It comes with a brick red colored scorpion which is rather cool to have and a rare piece at that.

Standing it next to my Witch Minifigure and having seen pictures of the Vampire, Werewolf, Zombie and Frankenstein's Monster minfigures, he works great for a Halloween Monsters theme and/or Universal Monster minifigure collection.

When putting it next to the mummies from the Pharoah's Quest theme, he suddenly feels out of place... all the Pharoah's Quest mummies that I have are grey, suggesting age and the CM mummy is white, looking brand new and made for a movie set.

Still he's good, I wasn't planning or hoping to get him, but while I quest to try and get the Tribal Chief and Rapper, there's other minifigures that I'm getting out of the packages before I seem to get my lucky breaks.

",TRUE,3,2,1,3,3
